alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 11:26AM CDT until June 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Thunderstorms brought additional rainfall to the area such that conditions have leveled off on the rivers, thus we remain in flood stage at least through this week if not into next week. Further rainfall will prolong our time in flood stage, however this week is not looking active at this time. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1100 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 13.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.8 feet on 06/17/1957. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
